alert.note: Alert for Frazier Mountain Communities; Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Grapevine; Kern River Valley; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Piute Walker Basin; San Joaquin River Canyon; South End of the Lower Sierra; Tehachapi; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 7:31PM PST until December 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...A WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches, with isolated amounts up to 30 inches conceivable. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Nevada foothills above 1,500 feet. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Sunday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you plan to travel, consider alternate strategies. If you must travel, carry plenty of food, a good deal of water, warm clothing, and a flashlight in your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
